ETYMOLOGY: From Old French circonference, or directly from Latin circumferentia ('a carrying around'), from circumferre ('to carry around'), from circum ('around') + ferre ('to carry').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The enclosing boundary of a curved geometric figure, especially a circle.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 圆形或曲线图形的周长或周界（指边界本身）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The geometer calculated the circumference of the circle with a precise formula.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 几何学家用精确的公式计算了圆的周长。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The distance around a circular or elliptical object or area.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某物（尤指圆形或椭圆形物体或区域）的周长或周边距离。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He measured the tree's circumference to see how old it was.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他测量了这棵树的周长以判断它的年龄。
